peril.model.states

Class Test_Fortify

  • java.lang.Object
    • peril.model.states.Test_Fortify

  • public final class Test_Fortify
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests that Fortify functions properly.
    Since:
    2018-03-16
    Version:
    1.01.03
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    Fortify

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Test_Fortify.TestGC
      A version of the GameController that is tailored to only provide the functionality used for Test_Fortify.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ModelPlayer testCurrentPlayer
      The ModelPlayer that is currently active in the game.
      private ModelCountry testDestination
      The end of the ModelCountry chain.
      private ModelPlayer testEnemyPlayer
      Another ModelPlayer that serves as the enemy to the testCurrentPlayer.
      private Fortify testFortify
      The Fortify being tested.
      private ModelCountry testSource
      The start of the ModelCountry chain.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Test_Fortify() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Sets up the elements that will be used by every test to test Fortify.
      void test_fortify_moveUnit()
      Tests Fortify.fortify() moves one unit if two valid ModelCountrys are selected.
      void test_getPathBetween_normal()
      Tests that Fortify.getPathBetween(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelUnit) functions properly.
      void test_getPathBetween_reverse()
      Tests that Fortify.getPathBetween(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelUnit) functions properly.
      void test_select_blockedPath()
      Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select the source and destination ModelCountry if there an blocked path between them.
      void test_select_enoughUnits()
      Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will select the source ModelCountry if there is more than one ModelUnit in the ModelArmy.
      void test_select_notEnoughUnits()
      Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select the source ModelCountry if there is only one ModelUnit in the ModelArmy.
      void test_select_null()
      Tests that Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select null.
      void test_select_nullDeselect()
      Tests that Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select null but will also de-select any ModelCountrys that are selected.
      void test_select_openPath()
      Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will select the source and destination ModelCountry if there an open path between them.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • testCurrentPlayer

        private ModelPlayer testCurrentPlayer
        The ModelPlayer that is currently active in the game. This is the ModelPlayer that will be returned from Test_Fortify.TestGC.getCurrentModelPlayer().

      • testEnemyPlayer

        private ModelPlayer testEnemyPlayer
        Another ModelPlayer that serves as the enemy to the testCurrentPlayer.

      • testSource

        private ModelCountry testSource
        The start of the ModelCountry chain.

      • testDestination

        private ModelCountry testDestination
        The end of the ModelCountry chain.

      • testFortify

        private Fortify testFortify
        The Fortify being tested.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Test_Fortify

        public Test_Fortify()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets up the elements that will be used by every test to test Fortify.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If setup fails throw Exception.

      • test_getPathBetween_normal

        public void test_getPathBetween_normal()
        Tests that Fortify.getPathBetween(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelUnit) functions properly. The path from origin to destination is completely open.

      • test_getPathBetween_reverse

        public void test_getPathBetween_reverse()
        Tests that Fortify.getPathBetween(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelUnit) functions properly. The path from origin to destination has one blockaded link.

      • test_select_notEnoughUnits

        public void test_select_notEnoughUnits()
        Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select the source ModelCountry if there is only one ModelUnit in the ModelArmy.

      • test_select_enoughUnits

        public void test_select_enoughUnits()
        Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will select the source ModelCountry if there is more than one ModelUnit in the ModelArmy.

      • test_select_openPath

        public void test_select_openPath()
        Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will select the source and destination ModelCountry if there an open path between them.

      • test_select_blockedPath

        public void test_select_blockedPath()
        Tests the Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select the source and destination ModelCountry if there an blocked path between them.

      • test_select_null

        public void test_select_null()
        Tests that Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select null.

      • test_select_nullDeselect

        public void test_select_nullDeselect()
        Tests that Fortify.select(ModelCountry) will not select null but will also de-select any ModelCountrys that are selected.

      • test_fortify_moveUnit

        public void test_fortify_moveUnit()
        Tests Fortify.fortify() moves one unit if two valid ModelCountrys are selected.
